source.6cb55e1a:
# You code here
data[data.salary =='>50K'].age.mean()
data[data.salary =='>50K'].age.std()

print("mean age of poor = {0} +/- {1}".format(
    round(data[data.salary =='<=50K'].age.mean()),
    round(data[data.salary =='<=50K'].age.std()))
     )
source.ebe8d1bd:
# You code here
share_of_rich_in_married_men = (data.loc[(data.sex == 'Male') &
     data['marital-status'].isin(['Married-civ-spouse','Married-spouse-absent','Married-AF-spouse']),
                                         'salary'].value_counts(normalize=True)*100)[1]

print('Share of rich among married men is {0} %'.format(round(share_of_rich_in_married_men)))
source.2db01982:
share_of_rich_in_single_men = (data.loc[(data.sex == 'Male') &
     data['marital-status'].isin(['Never-married','Separated','Divorced','Widowed']), 
                                        'salary'].value_counts(normalize=True)*100)[1]

print('Share of rich among single men is {0} %'.format(round(share_of_rich_in_single_men)))

data['hours-per-week'].max()

print('maximum number of hours a person works per week is',data['hours-per-week'].max())
source.7a157805:
data['hours-per-week'] == data['hours-per-week'].max().sum()

print('number of people working the most is',(data['hours-per-week'] == data['hours-per-week'].max()).sum())
source.00567518:
(data.loc[data['hours-per-week'] == data['hours-per-week'].max(),'salary'].value_counts(normalize=True)*100).values[1]
    
print('share of rich in people working the most is {} %'.format(
    round((data.loc[data['hours-per-week'] == data['hours-per-week'].max(),'salary'].value_counts(normalize=True)*100).values[1])))
source.f690e626:

#data.pivot_table(['hours-per-week'],columns = ['native-country'],index =['salary'], aggfunc='mean')
data.groupby(['native-country','salary'])['hours-per-week'].mean().unstack().T

source.315eff7c: **10. Count the average time of work (*hours-per-week*) for those who earn a little and a lot (*salary*) for each country (*native-country*). What will these be for Japan?**
source.cd273b24: **7. Display age statistics for each race (*race* feature) and each gender (*sex* feature). Find the maximum age of men of *Amer-Indian-Eskimo* race.**
source.7562d803: **In this task you should use Pandas to answer a few questions about the [Adult](https://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/datasets/Adult) dataset. (You don't have to download the data – it's already here). Choose the answers in the [web-form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1uY7MpI2trKx6FLWZte0uVh3ULV4Cm_tDud0VDFGCOKg). This is a demo version of an assignment, so by submitting the form, you'll see a link to the solution .ipynb file.**
source.e5d744e1: **9. What is the maximum number of hours a person works per week (*hours-per-week* feature)? How many people work such a number of hours, and what is the percentage of those who earn a lot (>50K) among them?**
source.e5fe9fce: **4-5. What are the mean and standard deviation of age for those who earn more than 50K per year (*salary* feature) and those who earn less than 50K per year?**
source.e18c4e04: **2. What is the average age (*age* feature) of women?**
source.eac34f56: **3. What is the percentage of German citizens (*native-country* feature)?**
source.8a6c0441: **8. Among whom is the proportion of those who earn a lot (>50K) greater: married or single men (*marital-status* feature)? Consider as married those who have a *marital-status* starting with *Married* (Married-civ-spouse, Married-spouse-absent or Married-AF-spouse), the rest are considered bachelors.**
source.6b03e83a:
# <center> Assignment #1 (demo)
## <center>  Exploratory data analysis with Pandas
source.255dcc1f: **6. Is it true that people who earn more than 50K have at least high school education? (*education – Bachelors, Prof-school, Assoc-acdm, Assoc-voc, Masters* or *Doctorate* feature)**
source.55a4fd4c: **1. How many men and women (*sex* feature) are represented in this dataset?**
source.9f22eadb:
Unique values of all features (for more information, please see the links above):
- `age`: continuous.
- `workclass`: Private, Self-emp-not-inc, Self-emp-inc, Federal-gov, Local-gov, State-gov, Without-pay, Never-worked.
- `fnlwgt`: continuous.
- `education`: Bachelors, Some-college, 11th, HS-grad, Prof-school, Assoc-acdm, Assoc-voc, 9th, 7th-8th, 12th, Masters, 1st-4th, 10th, Doctorate, 5th-6th, Preschool.
- `education-num`: continuous.
- `marital-status`: Married-civ-spouse, Divorced, Never-married, Separated, Widowed, Married-spouse-absent, Married-AF-spouse.
- `occupation`: Tech-support, Craft-repair, Other-service, Sales, Exec-managerial, Prof-specialty, Handlers-cleaners, Machine-op-inspct, Adm-clerical, Farming-fishing, Transport-moving, Priv-house-serv, Protective-serv, Armed-Forces.
- `relationship`: Wife, Own-child, Husband, Not-in-family, Other-relative, Unmarried.
- `race`: White, Asian-Pac-Islander, Amer-Indian-Eskimo, Other, Black.
- `sex`: Female, Male.
- `capital-gain`: continuous.
- `capital-loss`: continuous.
- `hours-per-week`: continuous.
- `native-country`: United-States, Cambodia, England, Puerto-Rico, Canada, Germany, Outlying-US(Guam-USVI-etc), India, Japan, Greece, South, China, Cuba, Iran, Honduras, Philippines, Italy, Poland, Jamaica, Vietnam, Mexico, Portugal, Ireland, France, Dominican-Republic, Laos, Ecuador, Taiwan, Haiti, Columbia, Hungary, Guatemala, Nicaragua, Scotland, Thailand, Yugoslavia, El-Salvador, Trinadad&Tobago, Peru, Hong, Holand-Netherlands.   
- `salary`: >50K,<=50K
